keyword: how many calories are in ribeye steak
title: How Many Calories Are in Ribeye Steak?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in ribeye steak, including full nutrition breakdown per 100g basis, totals for an 8 oz serving, protein, fat details, and preparation tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Ribeye Steak?
assumptions: Boneless ribeye steak, USDA choice grade, grilled without added fat; average serving size 8 oz (227 g) cooked weight, includes lean and fat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, grade, fat trimming, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One 8 oz grilled ribeye steak contains about 661 kcal and 56 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant data.

faqs.q: How many calories are in ribeye steak per 100g?
faqs.a: About 291 kcal per 100 g of grilled ribeye steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 56 g protein in an 8 oz serving.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling retains more fat than broiling; added oils or butter increase calories.

faqs.q: How much fat is in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: About 22 g total fat per 100 g, with 9 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars—it's nearly all protein and fat.
